title: Basic Reading Skills
description: Learn to read simple words and sentences. Perfect for beginners starting their literacy journey.

lessons.title: The Alphabet - A to M
lessons.content:
Welcome to your first lesson! Today we will learn the first half of the alphabet.

**A** - Apple
**B** - Ball
**C** - Cat
**D** - Dog
**E** - Egg
**F** - Fish
**G** - Girl
**H** - House
**I** - Ice
**J** - Jump
**K** - King
**L** - Lion
**M** - Moon

Practice saying each letter out loud.

lessons.title: The Alphabet - N to Z
lessons.content:
Let's continue learning the alphabet!

**N** - Net
**O** - Orange
**P** - Pen
**Q** - Queen
**R** - Rain
**S** - Sun
**T** - Tree
**U** - Umbrella
**V** - Van
**W** - Water
**X** - Box
**Y** - Yellow
**Z** - Zebra

Great work! You now know all 26 letters.

lessons.title: Simple Words
lessons.content:
Now let's put letters together to make words.

**cat** - C-A-T
**dog** - D-O-G
**sun** - S-U-N
**run** - R-U-N
**big** - B-I-G
**yes** - Y-E-S
**not** - N-O-T
**can** - C-A-N

Practice reading these words slowly.

lessons.title: Reading Sentences
lessons.content:
Let's read simple sentences together.

**I can run.**
**The cat is big.**
**The sun is hot.**
**I see a dog.**
**Yes, I can.**

Read each sentence out loud. Take your time!

title: Introduction to Sewing
description: Learn basic sewing skills including hand stitching, using a needle, and simple repairs.

lessons.title: Sewing Tools and Safety
lessons.content:
Welcome to sewing! Let's learn about the tools you need.

**Basic Tools:**
- Needle
- Thread
- Scissors
- Pins
- Measuring tape
- Fabric

**Safety Rules:**
1. Always keep needles and pins in a safe place
2. Cut away from your body
3. Keep scissors closed when not using
4. Store tools properly after use

Remember: Safety first!

lessons.title: Threading a Needle
lessons.content:
Threading a needle is an important skill.

**Steps:**
1. Cut thread about 50cm long
2. Hold needle in one hand
3. Push thread through the eye of the needle
4. Pull thread through until both ends are even
5. Tie a small knot at the end

**Tip:** If you have trouble seeing, try using a needle threader or do it in good light.

Practice this several times until it feels easy.

lessons.title: Basic Running Stitch
lessons.content:
The running stitch is the most basic stitch.

**How to do it:**
1. Push needle up through fabric from bottom
2. Pull thread all the way through
3. Push needle back down through fabric
4. Come up again a little distance away
5. Repeat to make a line of stitches

**Uses:**
- Joining two pieces of fabric
- Gathering fabric
- Temporary stitching

Practice on scrap fabric until your stitches are even.

lessons.title: Sewing a Button
lessons.content:
Learn to sew on a button - a very useful skill!

**Steps:**
1. Thread needle and tie a knot
2. Mark where button should go
3. Push needle up from back of fabric
4. Put needle through one hole in button
5. Go back down through another hole
6. Repeat 4-5 times
7. Tie off thread at the back
8. Cut excess thread

**Practice:** Find an old shirt and practice sewing buttons.

This skill can help you fix clothes and even earn money!

lessons.title: Simple Repairs
lessons.content:
Now you can fix common clothing problems.

**Fixing a Small Tear:**
1. Turn garment inside out
2. Pin edges of tear together
3. Use running stitch to sew along tear
4. Make stitches close together
5. Tie off and cut thread

**Fixing a Hem:**
1. Fold fabric to desired length
2. Pin in place
3. Use running stitch to sew hem
4. Remove pins as you go
5. Press with iron if available

**Congratulations!** You now have basic sewing skills that can help you and others.

title: Basic Mathematics
description: Learn counting, addition, and subtraction for everyday life.

lessons.title: Counting 1 to 20
lessons.content:
Let's learn to count!

**1** - One
**2** - Two
**3** - Three
**4** - Four
**5** - Five
**6** - Six
**7** - Seven
**8** - Eight
**9** - Nine
**10** - Ten

**11** - Eleven
**12** - Twelve
**13** - Thirteen
**14** - Fourteen
**15** - Fifteen
**16** - Sixteen
**17** - Seventeen
**18** - Eighteen
**19** - Nineteen
**20** - Twenty

Practice counting forward and backward.

lessons.title: Simple Addition
lessons.content:
Addition means putting numbers together.

**Examples:**
- 1 + 1 = 2
- 2 + 2 = 4
- 3 + 2 = 5
- 4 + 3 = 7
- 5 + 5 = 10

**Practice:**
- 2 + 3 = ?
- 4 + 4 = ?
- 6 + 2 = ?
- 3 + 5 = ?

You can use your fingers to help count!

lessons.title: Simple Subtraction
lessons.content:
Subtraction means taking away.

**Examples:**
- 5 - 2 = 3
- 10 - 5 = 5
- 8 - 3 = 5
- 7 - 4 = 3
- 6 - 1 = 5

**Practice:**
- 9 - 4 = ?
- 10 - 3 = ?
- 8 - 2 = ?
- 7 - 5 = ?

Think: If you have 7 oranges and give away 5, how many are left?
